name: Ruddy Ground Dove
description: A small dove species named for the cinnamon coloration of its wings and back.
food_note: Mainly seeds and small fruits, shoots, and rarely insects
image_alt: Ruddy ground dove, photo: Prague Zoo archive
reproduction: Females lay 2 eggs; incubation lasts 11–13 days.
attractions: It typically moves in pairs or small flocks, descending to the ground to forage. In some parts of South America, it has adapted to urban centers, nesting on beams under roofs or on verandas.
breeding: The first pair of doves arrived at the zoo in 2007, followed by a break in breeding (2008–2013), with another pair arriving in March 2013.
